purpleculture_pinyin:
xié
to carry; to take along; to bring along; to hold (hands); also pr. [xi1]
нести; взять с собой; взять с собой; держать (руками); также пр. [xi1]

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 携)
Pictophonetic: 巂 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
攜帶 [ xié dài ]: to carry (on one's person); to support (old); Taiwan pr. [xi1 dai4]
攜手 [ xié shǒu ]: hand in hand; to join hands; to collaborate
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 巂 [ guī ] a place name
heisig_chinese_memo: Little red riding hood decides to take along lunch for her grandmother in a car this time but wrecks the car.
Ru_trainchinese: xié: (графема) нести, брать с собой; держать за руку
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Imagine you've just arrived in China, but don't have a cell phone yet, so instead you take along a portable turkey you can hold in your fist. To dial a number, just poke it with your fingers.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " hand " and "巂", the original meaning is to lift and lift. "Said Wen": "Take it. From the hand, the sound." "Poetry‧Daya‧Board": "The heaven of the people is like a sanitary ware like a chi, like a zhang like a gui, like taking like a carry. Carrying means that things are on the ground and carried by hands."

" Carry " can mean holding or holding. Tang Lihe "Golden Bronze Immortal Ci Han Song": "Bringing a plate alone out of the desolation of the moon, Weicheng has been far away and the sound is quiet."

" Carry " also means to carry. "Zhuangzi: Let the King": "So the husband bears his wife and takes his son into the sea, and he will never turn back for life."

" Carrying " also means holding and supporting. "Huainanzi: Viewing the Mind Training": "Huainanzi's car abuses, the mud is smeared to the knees, and the road is carried together, and the head is on the road."

" Carry " also means to connect. "Historical Records-Official Book of the Heavens": "Pipe carrying dragon horns, Heng Yin Nandou, Kui pillows the head." Pei Qi Ji quoted Meng Kang as saying: "Carry, even."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " hand " and "巂", the original meaning is to lift and lift.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「巂」聲，本義為提起、提着。《說文》：「提也。从手，巂聲。」《詩‧大雅‧板》：「天之牖民，如壎如箎，如璋如圭，如取如攜。」孔穎達疏：「攜，謂物在地上，手舉攜之。」

　　「攜」可表示持、拿着。唐李賀〈金銅仙人辭漢歌〉：「攜盤獨出月荒涼，渭城已遠波聲小。」

　　「攜」也表示攜帶。《莊子‧讓王》：「於是夫負妻戴，攜子以入於海，終身不反也。」

　　「攜」還表示牽挽、攙扶。《淮南子‧覽冥訓》：「人羸車弊，泥塗至膝，相攜於道，奮首於路。」

　　「攜」亦表示連接。《史記‧天官書》：「杓攜龍角，衡殷南斗，魁枕參首。」裴駰集解引孟康曰：「攜，連也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「巂」聲，本義為提起、提着。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
攜 (Simplified: 携)
Pinyin: xié
English Definition: to carry; to take along; to bring along; to hold (hands); also pr. [xi1]
Total strokes: 21; Radical: 手
Pictophonetic: 巂 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 巂 [ guī ] a place name
Example Words:
攜帶 [ xié dài ]: to carry (on one's person); to support (old); Taiwan pr. [xi1 dai4]
攜手 [ xié shǒu ]: hand in hand; to join hands; to collaborate
More: 攜* | *攜 | *攜*

從「 手 」，「 巂 」聲，本義為提起、提着。《說文》：「提也。从手，巂聲。」《詩‧大雅‧板》：「天之牖民，如壎如箎，如璋如圭，如取如攜。」孔穎達疏：「攜，謂物在地上，手舉攜之。」 「 攜 」可表示持、拿着。唐李賀〈金銅仙人辭漢歌〉：「攜盤獨出月荒涼，渭城已遠波聲小。」 「 攜 」也表示攜帶。《莊子‧讓王》：「於是夫負妻戴，攜子以入於海，終身不反也。」 「 攜 」還表示牽挽、攙扶。《淮南子‧覽冥訓》：「人羸車弊，泥塗至膝，相攜於道，奮首於路。」 「 攜 」亦表示連接。《史記‧天官書》：「杓攜龍角，衡殷南斗，魁枕參首。」裴駰集解引孟康曰：「攜，連也。」
From the sound of " hand" and " 巂", the original meaning is to lift and lift. "Said Wen": "Take it. From the hand, the sound." "Poetry‧Daya‧Board": "The heaven of the people is like a sanitary ware like a chi, like a zhang like a gui, like taking like a carry. Carrying means that things are on the ground and carried by hands." " Carry" can mean holding or holding. Tang Lihe "Golden Bronze Immortal Ci Han Song": "Bringing a plate alone out of the desolation of the moon, Weicheng has been far away and the sound is quiet." " Carry" also means to carry. "Zhuangzi: Let the King": "So the husband bears his wife and takes his son into the sea, and he will never turn back for life." " Carrying" also means holding and supporting. "Huainanzi: Viewing the Mind Training": "Huainanzi's car abuses, the mud is smeared to the knees, and the road is carried together, and the head is on the road." " Carry" also means to connect. "Historical Records-Official Book of the Heavens": "Pipe carrying dragon horns, Heng Yin Nandou, Kui pillows the head." Pei Qi Ji quoted Meng Kang as saying: "Carry, even."

攜字的基本解释

攜
xié
同“携”。

攜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xié］
［《廣韻》户圭切，平齊，匣。］
亦作“擕1”。亦作“携1”。
(1)提起，提着。
(2)持，拿着。
(3)携带。
(4)牵挽；搀扶。
(5)连接。
(6)离心；离散；离间。
(7)谓远离尘世。

攜字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　攜； 康熙笔画：22； 页码：页463第31
【唐韻】戸圭切【集韻】懸圭切，?音畦。【說文】提也。【六書故】縣持也。【書·立政】左右攜僕。【註】攜持僕御之人。【詩·大雅】如取如攜。【疏】物在地上，手舉攜之。【禮·曲禮】長者與之提攜，則兩手奉長者之手。【註】提攜，謂牽將行。　又離也。【左傳·僖七年】招攜以禮。【周語】節度不攜。　又連也。【前漢·天文志】杓攜龍角。【註】杓，斗柄也。　又姓。見【姓苑】。或省作㩦。俗作携㩗擕，非。

攜字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
攜字的起名意思

暂无。

carry
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xié］
["Guangyun" Hu Guiqie, flat, box. ]
Also known as "carry 1". Also known as "carry 1".
(1) Lift and carry.
(2) Hold, hold.
(3) Carry.
(4) To pull; to support.
(5) Connection.
(6) Centrifugation; separation; separation.
(7) Said to be far away from the world.
carry
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Collection] [Hands and Characters Department] 　 Carry; Kangxi Strokes: 22; Page Number: Page 463 31
[Tang Yun] Jian Guiqi [Ji Yun] Xuan Guiqi,? Yin Qi. [Said the text] mention also. [Six Books and Gu] The county holds. 【Book·Lizheng】Left and right hand servants. [Note] Those who carry a servant. 【Poetry·Daya】As if taking, like carrying. 【Sparse】The object is on the ground, holding it with your hands. 【Rite·Chu Li】The elders will support them with both hands and serve the elders. [Note] To support, that is to lead the way.　Leave again. [Zuo Zhuan·Seven Years of Xi] Recruit and bring gifts. [Zhou Yu] Jiedu does not carry.　It's even again. [Former Han·Astronomy] The dipper carries the dragon's horn. [Note] Dipper, bucket handle also.　Another last name. See [surname court]. Or province for 㩦. Popular work to carry 㩗 to carry, not.
